metadata.title: CVE-2019-8607 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. Thisissue is fixed in iOS 12.3, macOS Mojave 10.14.5, tvOS 12.3, watchOS 5.2.1,Safari 12.1.1, iTunes for Windows 12.9.5, iCloud for Windows 7.12.Processing maliciously crafted web content may result in the disclosure ofprocess memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8607` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.24.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.24.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.24.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.24.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.24.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.24.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.24.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
